I am fairly new to JUnit and am leading its integration at work. The one
question I get a lot is, "How do we test the results of a database query?"
The former method of testing the query, was to manually review the results.
The one solution we've come up with is to perform the query, save the
results to a file, then assert that the results from the live query are
equivalent to the stored results in the file. This gets a little more tricky
when the results data contains time-sensitive fields (i.e. date fields).

Anyway, I just wanted to know whether anyone had come up with a simpler
and/or better solution.

- Mike
subject: Database query results testing
